fainting goats have the condition
myotonia congenita it's a genetic
condition affecting a particular gene
telling muscles to tense and to reset to
relax again afterwards normally they
relax instantly and we're able to flee
or fight whatever we choose to do to
defend ourselves in this case the
signals from the brain are sending
through the message to tencel the
muscles but because of this genetic
condition the signals telling the
muscles to relax again on getting
through and so it tenses up can't run
away I've also booked some farmers used
to use these myotonic goats as decoys if
a wolf or some other predator were to
attack the herd of course the myotonic
goat is going to go down and that's
what's going to take the Predators
attention away from the rest of the herd
that's not very nice
and because all mammals muscles have

us are prone to myotonia congenita by
